definition: to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: Walton will continue to split time with Radmanovic.
sentences.chinese: 沃顿将继续和拉德马诺维奇分享上场时间。

sentences.english: Don't worry about risk the way it is taught at Wharton.
sentences.chinese: 别担心沃顿商学院所教的风险。

sentences.english: Edith Wharton was born in New York City in eighteen sixty-two.
sentences.chinese: 伊迪丝沃顿出生于纽约市一八六二年。

sentences.english: Bowie played in 511 games over 10 seasons.
sentences.chinese: 在十多个赛季中鲍威打了511场，沃顿468场。

sentences.english: The heart points towards Wotton Hill, where Janet is from.
sentences.chinese: 心尖指向沃顿山，那里是珍妮特的故乡。

sentences.english: I'm happy to be here at Wharton, traditionally a wonderful source of Merrill Lynch talent.
sentences.chinese: 很高兴来到沃顿，这里向来是美林公司理想的人才库。

sentences.english: Wharton spent much time at the White House.
sentences.chinese: 在这期间，沃顿绝大部分时间都在白宫。

sentences.english: Wharton San Francisco has no faculty of its own.
sentences.chinese: 沃顿商学院旧金山分院没有自己的教员。

sentences.english: But Warton expresses, study a group " who is not affirmatory and specific aggressor ".
sentences.chinese: 但沃顿表示，研究小组“不确定具体攻击者是谁”。

sentences.english: Luke Walton followed with a layup and the Lakers held on easily from there.
sentences.chinese: 后来沃顿上篮得分，接下来湖人就轻松控制了比赛。
